alert.note: Alert for Middlesex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:42AM EST until January 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Sudbury River At Saxonville affecting Middlesex County. For the Sudbury River...including Saxonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sudbury River at Saxonville. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding affects low lying areas of Wayland, including Pelham Island Road near Heards Pond. Shore Drive near Stonebridge Road will experience some flooding as well as Route 20 eastbound at Route 27. Flood waters will begin to impact portions of Nashawtuc Road, Sudbury Road and Route 117 in Concord. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM EST Wednesday was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.7 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM EST.
